definition: the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign

sentences.english: The final days of the 2008 race for president.
sentences.chinese: 下面介紹美國2008年總統大選最後幾天的選情。

sentences.english: Both McCain and Obama campaigning Sunday in battleground states.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬和麥凱恩都在選情不定的州開始競選活動。

sentences.english: The race is close and increasingly nasty.
sentences.chinese: 選情不但膠着，並且越來越惡劣。

sentences.english: West Bengal voters will decide on the Left Front next year.
sentences.chinese: 西孟加拉邦的選民，將會決定下一年左翼陣線的選情。

sentences.english: They counted on the party stalwarts for support in the off-year campaigns.
sentences.chinese: 選情不利的一年，他們只能依靠該黨的中堅分子了。

sentences.english: Election experts say, Romney and Huntsman are Mormon.
sentences.chinese: 選情專家說，羅姆尼與洪博培都是摩門教徒。

definition: could happen at any moment/on the verge
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
(Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder

pinyin: mao4 yi4 bao3 hu4 zhu3 yi4

definition: Saudi Arabia (Tw), abbr. for 沙烏地阿拉伯王國|沙乌地阿拉伯王国
